comments.commentBody: As it sputtered out, we revived it with guns and money and foreign jihadi recruits, just like we did in Afghanistan with bin Laden. It has worked out even worse than that did.

"How many people in history have managed to lose a billion dollars in a single year?"

To complete this thought: ".....and yet continued living in the style they are accustomed to."
I didn't know that Racists  felt embarassment...

I mean, really, a private citizen deemed 'too big to fail.'
Thank you NYTimes for fleshing out details on this unbelievable period that I'm sure the Donald would prefer no one know or recall. I first got the skinny on a good chunk of this on PBS' excellent recent Frontline "The Choice - 2016."
You forgot to put in as he was being relieved of his multiple failing businesses and their immense debts, he was given a $450,000 MONTHLY allowance -- in 1990! -- apparently just to live. And he was paid a management fee. Wow. Talk about an lucky escape. It helps to be a high roller, I guess.
And all those homeowners who were taken in the mortgage scam, all those retirement accounts wrecked, lives ruined and no help.
As my dear departed mother-in-law would say about all this ... 'it's a sin.'

Whenever I see a bird who makes fun of disabled people like Donald Trump does, disparages women like Donald Trump does, pays taxes like Donald Trump does, offends minorities like Donald Trump does, cheats small-business owners like Donald Trump does, wants more countries to have nuclear weapons like Donald Trump does, knows more about ISIS than our generals like Donald Trump does and evaded the draft like Donald Trump did, I put my cat out into the back yard.

Trump is saying the tax system is rigged to favor guys like him. When elected he will reform the tax laws so that they are fair for everybody.

Fair enough, that leads to 2 questions I have :

1 ) What changes exactly would he make to the tax laws ?

2 ) Just hypothetically, what would his net worth be today if the tax laws had been fair for the last 30 years or so ?

Seriously -- his taxes only showed legal deductions.

Do you think the IRS would "not notice" a $100 million deduction???

They have probably audited him EVERY YEAR. That's why Trump surely has the best crack team of accountants and tax attorneys that money can buy.

If they had advised him wrong....he would have been tapped by the IRS and FINED a long, long time ago.

Those taxes that were "revealed" in the NYT were from 1995 -- more than 20 years ago.

Even if he HAD cheated wildly then....the statute of limitations has long passed by.

Amazing he is the expert on everything from knowing more about military tactics then the generals - more about PTSD  then psychiatrists - more about the tax code then almost anybody - more about military service than those who actually served - he is a wellspring of knowledge about foreign affairs - why would we not want this consummate expert on everything running the whole show - and entrusting our assets in social security and medicare to him. What could possibly go wrong?

"His lenders forced him to live for a time on $450,000 a month." And Mr Trump Supporters, most of whom make between $40.000 to $70.000  per Year think that a Man who was FORCED by his Lenders  to live on a $450.000/Month understands their struggles.

"If success is measured by personal wealth..."
Firstly he was born not only in wealth and Trump organization founded by Elizabeth Trump (grandmother) & Son (Fred Trump), but also in daddy's clout, connections, daddy's loans and daddy's so-signing.
Secondly you know about his wealth only from his braggadocio "me me me me!"
"I play to people's fantasies" - Trump.
If buildings have his name doesn't mean he owns them, his casinos resulted in bankruptcies, his golf courses according to analysts are worth less than he’s spent on them and some are held by other investors...majority interest in his "Trump Place" was held by investors from Hong Kong ... Trump Entertainment Resorts is owned by Carl Icahn...
Trump is a walking Enron. Swindling out of Peter to pay Paul.

Politics is no place for high-stakes hustlers. Perhaps there is somewhere a fat-cat who could make passable president, but the Don is not the right Mr. Big to bet the national chips on.

Trump's constituency wants so much to believe he's some great American success story they'll just dig in & bet all-in on orange.

This is the way it apparently goes with Ponzi schemes & cons: the Mark has to want to believe, no matter how dubious or demonstrably disproved the scheme seems to the unfooled.

Back in late-80s NYC you didn't need to fully follow the inner machinations of junk-bonds & gentrificating greedsters to see that the Don was a flaming fake. But he wasn't a national security risk back then, just a peculiarly flashy yuppie, later some farcical prime-time megalomaniac/egocentric/eccentric as billionaires sometimes seem to become.

Trump's sudden interest in what to a NYC developer has always been 'flyover country' asks not what Trump can do for Red State America, but what Limbaugh Land can do for Trump.

The heartland is getting scammed yet again. How a demographic that dumped Dubbya on the world & nearly impaled us on Palin, can now bet the farm on Trump is more the story, & the mystery than the Don himself.

What if your back was one of those he clawed as he so valiantly made he way back from the brink?  Oh, that's okay, you didn't need to be paid for your work. Watching his heroic recovery from every self-inflicted disaster was payment enough!

Wow, what a great Horatio Alger story!

I almost shed a tear.

Except trump was born at the top. Fell to the bottom through his own dumb decisions. And then like the two-bit con he is, used investers' and we the stupid taxpayers' money to claw his way back to a TV reality show.

I guess he wasn't smart enough pull off a Bernie Madoff. But getting himself elected will be a bigger con than Madoff's.

And shameless trump will brag about it.
Oh really...you think Drumpf has been in the deepest valley? Was that when he was 'forced' to live on 450K a month? Hard times to be sure.

I admire Trump as a businessman and, in many ways, as a person, too. It is really, really hard to make it in this world, especially if you have big dreams, and there will always be people eager to kick you when you're down. Trump has both been on top of the highest mountain and in the deepest valley, and I admire the man who has been able to claw his way back from the brink of ruin.

Having said that, I still don't believe that he's qualified to be President.
Funny -- the CLINTON'S were friends with him enough, to have been invited to his wedding to Melania, and I believe Trump was invited to Chelsea's wedding too.
The Republican Party lost all chances of my vote since the Watergate break-in. So what's new?

He may have been at the brink of personal bankruptcy but we can all confirm, with absolute certainty, that he toppled over the edge of moral bankruptcy 50 years ago.

This, ladies and gentlemen, is the standard-bearer of the Republican Party.
A global brand that represents a deplorable person.
Just because he loses doesn't mean there isn't a big problem in America.

I love this.

This campaign has now evolved into a contest between Trump and his horde of step-brats and paid flunkies, and every intelligent, decent person on the planet.

How did The Times get this information? A decent, intelligent person, one of the billions outside Russia and China who understand the potential disaster his election as President would represent for the planet and the people on it, made a point of supplying the information in a way that they thought would do most damage to the Trump campaign.

Who wouldn't? What all intelligent and decent people on the planet can be sure of is that every other intelligent and decent person on the planet is spending time trying to think of anything they can do to assist Hillary Clinton defeat Trump. It is a comfort.

Of course, the fact that there are about 80 million adult Americans who apparently want Trump to be president is a horrifying and sickening reality we all have to deal with - but there we see the reality of human civilisation condensed into a small, comprehensible nutshell - while a sadly large minority of the human race grow into adulthood as stunted, sick, malign creatures, the majority turn out to be intelligent and decent - or at least on the side of those who are intelligent and decent.

Happily, it has been clear since Day One - if you just look at the polls and don't try to mis-characterise reality - the Trump has never had a chance of winning - but seeing him crushed will still be a relief.
That's nonsense.

We already know from an article published recently by the Times that he amassed almost a billion dollars (I think it was 887 million) in real estate tax deferrals and deals from city and state funds. A billion here, a billion there ....

There's nothing wrong with taking advantage of tax code. However, bragging about it and basically showing the middle finger to everyone else is shameful to say the least. Trump's cares first about himself, second about his mirror, and third to nobody else.
Really?  How do we actually know he is a success?  He obscured his failures in the past. I suspect Trump is hiding his failures now.

So you're okay if he causes the U.S. economy to "incur losses for years" then must hope that his successors can stage a successful comeback?!

My money is on someone who has always been successful; not a very slow learner.

I generally dislike Mr. Trump for his bigotry and racist views. But this article describes a man who is resilient and steadfast! A leader material I would say. Let's criticize him for where he is wrong and not try to find him wrong where we would praise others in the similar situation. He incurred loses for years and made a successful come back. I think that's admirable. I think that is a very American trait!

Wall Street, MSM, political establishment of both parties are fighting him tooth and nail. Is that because he intends to reward them?

Hillary Clinton is the Wall Street queen. All her personal money has come from them, and you think she's on your side? Don't make me laugh.
They are NOT running for President on their business acumen. They are comfortable being entertainers - so should the candidate.

Trump is full of secrets and it seems as they come to light that every one of them is dirty. Clearly the Republican nominee for president is someone who badly needs to be stopped and frisked daily on account of his proven inability to keep his hands off of his very most favorite thing, OPM (aka: other people's money).

My bone density also improved when I was undergoing cancer treatment, despite the fact that I lost way too much weight, but I still have osteopenia, and despite taking a PPI and a SSRI.  My only therapy was Evista.  My doctor says it does not have the track record the meds mentioned in the article do, but I had radiation to my mandible, and am already at risk for osteonecrosis of that bone due to the radiation it received.  The more common drugs for osteoporosis would increase this risk.
Dan is being very Roman, paraphrasing Tacitus, *they make a desert, and call it peace*.

Has DT ever created or produced Anything within the DNA that evolves, elevates, enlightens, and energizes us to try to repeat and do again?
His great again slogan is the immaculate conception of the hopeful, and hopeless.
Who are we, how did he happen?
Our elected are impotent, neutered, beholden, and not the answer.
Everyone. Think, be strong, examine your conscience.
We can.
